CLEAN COALITION NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Pursuant to Rule 8.4 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (Commission), the Clean Coalition hereby provides this notice of an ex parte communication, initiated by the Clean Coalition. The meeting took place on Wednesday, July 24, 2024, from 1:00 p.m.  1:30 p.m. and was attended by Khalil Johnson, Advisor to President Reynolds. Ben Schwartz, Policy Manager, attended on behalf of the Clean Coalition. The meeting was held virtually, using Webex.

CLEAN COALITION THREE-DAY ADVANCE NOTICE OF EX PARTE MEETING Pursuant to Rule 8.2(c)(2) of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (Commission), this notice is given that the Clean Coalition requested, and was granted an ex parte meeting. The meeting is scheduled to take place on July 24, 2024, from 1:00 - 1:30 p.m. via Webex with Khalil Johnson, Advisor to President Reynolds. The following individuals will attend the meeting on behalf of the Clean Coalition: Ben Schwartz, Policy Manager, and Craig Lewis, Executive Director.

GREEN POWER INSTITUTE THREE DAY ADVANCED NOTICE OF EX PARTE MEETING In accordance with the Commission’s Rules of Practice and Procedure, the Green Power Institute respectfully submits this Three-Day Advanced Notice of Ex Parte Meeting. On January 6, 2023, GPI Director Gregg Morris will hold a zoom meeting with Kerry Fleisher, Chief of Staff to Commission President Alice Reynolds, to discuss a Proposed Decision on GPI’s July 30, 2021,Intervenor Compensation Claim in R.17-07-007.President Reynolds is the assigned Commissioner for the subject proceeding. As part of the conversation, we will discuss a handout that we have put together for the purpose. We are attaching a copy of thishandoutto this notice

ASSIGNED COMMISSIONER’S THIRD AMENDED SCOPING MEMO. This Third Amended Scoping Memo clarifies that a proposed decision in Phase II of this proceeding will be issued no later than 90 days after Reply Briefs are filed, which is currently estimated to be September 2022. This Third Amended Scoping Memo further clarifies that, pursuant to Public Utilities Code Section 1701.5 (b), Phase II of this proceeding will be resolved no later than 18 months after the commencement of Phase II, which is currently estimated to begin in December 2021.

Scoping Memo of Assigned Commissioner and Administrative Law Judge. The category of Phases One and Three of this proceeding is quasi-legislative; Phase Two is categorized as ratesetting. An evidentiary hearing is not necessary at this time, but may be needed at a later date. The scope of the issues and the schedule for this proceeding are as set forth. Ex parte communications are permitted without restriction or reporting for Phase One and Three of this proceeding. With limited exceptions that are subject to reporting requirements, ex parte communications are prohibited in Phase Two of this proceeding.  In Phase Two of this proceeding, Administrative Law Judge Kelly A. Hymes is designated as the Presiding Officer.
